page.title: 06RECREATION
page.content:
About 25 years ago a young girl called {Dorothy Hyman}became famous as one of the fastest women sprinters in the world. As she had had to train in the local park, local people raised money to build a{stadium}for all sports; it was opened on 28 April 1973 by {Michael Parkinson}the TV personality who also came from{Cudworth.
Now the stadium is run by Barnsley Council and there has been added a all-weather running track, squash courts and social club. Outdoor sports played there are athletics, soccer, cricket, bowls, tennis and archery; indoors people can take part in weight training, badminton, squash, 5-a-side soccer, bowls, snooker, pool and darts, all of which are taken to competition level.
